title: Cohesion & Coupling
subject: Software Engineering
theory:
The Golden Rule of Design. 
1. **Cohesion**: Strength of relationship INSIDE a module. High is good (Module does one thing well). 
2. **Coupling**: Dependence BETWEEN modules. Low is good (Change in A doesn't break B).

examples.code:
Bad: God Class (Low Cohesion, manages User, DB, and UI).
Good: User Class (High Cohesion, manages User only).

common_mistakes.correction: If Class A calls Class B's private database directly, they are tightly coupled. Use Interfaces.
